results.title: The Eiffel Tower
results.creator_credit: Le Monde en Images and Alain Pol
results.brief_description: How four French alpinists climbed the Eiffel Tower - from the outside. Using rock climbing techniques, the party scales the steel girders to the top, 1,000 feet above ground level. In hot pursuit, an angry policeman ascends the tower by the more conventional stairs and lifts, but to no avail.

results.title: The Egg of oryzias latipes
results.brief_description: Artificial fertilization of the killifish. through constant research a method of artificial fertilization of the transparent eggs of killifish or oryzias latipes, in Ringer’s solution was discovered. The delayed-action camera shows the process observed through the microscope.
results.description: Artificial fertilization of the killifish. through constant research a method of artificial fertilization of the transparent eggs of killifish or oryzias latipes, in Ringer’s solution was discovered. The delayed-action camera shows the process observed through the microscope.

results.title: The Effects of fire
results.brief_description: This proposed public imaging piece shows a series of close up portraits of domestic objects being burnt to abstraction, creating an inventory of domestic combustion in this piece. Punctuated with subtle yet deliberate, almost mechanised camera moves and cut in a very subdued fashion, this piece will be predominantly shot with a macro lens and will also be given a highly colour saturated visual treatment in post production.

results.title: The Eel
results.brief_description: Eel is an important source of Vitamin A, and a popular food in Japan. The life cycle of the eel is illustrated, showing the migration of the baby eels from their oceanic birth places to the coast of Japan, and subsequent life in the streams or in the commercial ponds of the eel farms. The techniques of eel-raising are shown.

results.title: The Edinburgh Festival
results.brief_description: Highlights of the Edinburgh Festivals of 1963 and 1964 closing with one of the most popular items in the Festival, the Military Tattoo on the esplanade of Edinburgh Castle. (Awarded a Cup by the Minister of Tourism, 7th International Festival of Tourist Films, Milan, 1966)

results.title: The edge of the possible
results.creator_credit: Sue Maslin, Film Art Doco Pty Ltd and Daryl Dellora
results.brief_description: Joern Utzon, the Danish architect of the Sydney Opera House lives in Hellebaek, Denmark in a modest house he built himself. He is 80 years old and in his distinguished career he has recieved every major archticetural award. But in February 1966, it was a very differet story. In that month his nine years work on the Opera House came to an end. This beautifully photographed films charts the triumphant, exhilarating and then tragic course of the design and construction of the Sydney Opera House. For the first time in 25 years Joern Utzon appears in a lengthy interview speaking in English.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sue Maslin, Film Art Doco Pty Ltd and Daryl Dellora

results.title: The Economic and Social Council
results.creator_credit: Krishna Singh and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United Nations: Its Charter and Organization”.
Describes how the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations strives to promote international co-operation in fighting economic and social misery wherever it exists.

results.title: The Ecology of development
results.creator_credit: George A. Colburn, Darrel Schwandt, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Factors such as biological inheritance, temperament, caregiving, family, peers, schooling, culture and history are introduced. Four levels of the environment are defined and illustrated: microsystem, mesosystem, exosystem and macrosystem. We meet twelve families from five countries whose lives we share throughout the series.
